poem:
### Hidden Currents

In corridors of chalk and chatter,  
where innocence is meant to gather,  
shadows darken, whispers shiver—  
murmurs echo, reason quivers.  
  
Teach us not to hide the stain,  
to speak the silence, name the pain.  
Between the lessons, show the way—  
turn whispers into brighter day.
